This hotel is in the suberbs of Rome-quite a ways away from the city. And it wasn't a nice suberb either! I wouldn't even have gone out after dark! Our taxi driver-who has driven taxi for over 20 yrs in Rome-had no idea where this hotel was. It was tucked away in the midle of nowhere! The hotel does offer a free shuttle into a point in the city-the problem is that this point is no where near any attractions. After taking the shuttle you would have to take the underground to get anywhere. It would take over an hour to get to any attractions. My word of advice-spend the extra 50 or so dollars and stay in a decent hotel in rome! We stayed in the Ripa hotel-which was cheaper than the Zone -but was right in the city center. So please don't stay in the "slums" of Rome-it's not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Only a fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeeandVee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the Hotel Zone. While the hotel is clean and comfortable, it has definate shortcomings. It is too far out in the suburbs to be handy for sightseeing. Buses are several blocks away and taxis difficult. The hotel has a free shuttle but you have limited availablity in times and space. There is no restaurant in the hotel and the breakfast is very limited. There are VERY few restaurants in the neighborhood and a bus or taxi ride becomes necessary to get to a decent eatery. The hotel staff is pleasant but not terribly helpful. Overall we would recommend spending a few more Euro and staying closer in with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but a number of problems”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller1
Reviews.Content: Location for this hotel was appaling, it was difficult to find (with many taxi drivers needing us to direct them to it) and information from the hotel before we arrived was very misleading making out that the hotel was only a stones throw from the Vatican. As previously mentioned, although there was a shuttle bus, it was nearly always booked up and this meant you had to book ridiculously early to take advantage of it. The rooms were nice, with a reasonably priced minibar and the breakfast was one of the better continental breakfasts I have come across. I find staff incredibly unhelpful though, mainly when an electric box in the bathroom starting creating excessive noise, it took three compliants before the staff decided to act and sort the problem out. I am quite a laid back person when it comes to hotels, give me a comfy bed and a TV and I'm usually sorted, but I won't be intending to revisit this hotel anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Distance from town a problem”
Reviews.Author: Bilshe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week staying in the Zone hotel. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable breakfast ok as continental breakfasts go. We found the staff not unfriendly just indifferent. The blurb about the location of hotel very misleading ----although a shuttle bus provided it did not run very often ---and you had to book very well in advance to get seat There was a local bus with a stop about 5 minutes walk away which was ok but it took 20 minutes to go to the city so bearing in mind that most people would want to come home for rest before going back into town for dinner you were actually travelling 2 hours each day ----a lot of time out of your holiday

Reviews.Title: “Zone location beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok Location really is everything. Firstly the hotel is located in suburbs and so you have to catch a bus (990) into the vatican city. This takes approximately 30 mins to get to piazza cavour during the quiet times and up to 45 mins during rush hour. This is quite a problem. Imagine you have an early start at 8.00 spend the whole day in town and fancy heading back to your hotel to get changed. This means anywhere from 60-90 minute round trip to get to your hotel and then back into town for the night. Not good. Also you need to eat and the hotel has no restaurant and there are only snack bars or takeaways nearby. SO you really need to eat in town. meaning the journey or you stay out. Another very important point if you want to see the sights is that the journey only takes you to the vatican city, not rome city. To give you an idea it takes about an hour to get to rome city and the sites, and an 80 minutes to get to the colloseum. SO this hotel is a real hassle for those wanting to see all the sites over by the colloseum. ANd believe me this is where most of teh good sites are such as colloseum, palatino, baths of caracha(might be spelt wrong), trevi fountain etc. The catacombs are also this side and require another bus journey ( or walk as we did for over an hour from the baths). So bear in mind the catacombs are about 2 hours from the hotel. If you dont mind this and just want the st pauls bassillica and to see the cistine chapel etc then the hotel is 30-45 mins from here. Also with regards to the hotel. Breakfast is limited, you get rice krispies or cornflakes. You also get croissants and bread, plus if you are lucky and get there in time you get a yoghurt. They also provide a slice of cheese or slice of ham for you. I think its ltd. To cap it off because there is no restaurant there should be a kettle in the room, but there is no kettle. So no tea making facilities. There is a bar that no one goes to in the lobby. ITs lifeless. Other errors at the hotel are our key card needed reprogramming every day to allow us in the room and if you dont stick the shower curtain to the wall correctly the bathroom floods and there is no drain so it stays wet. on the positive the room is clean, spacious and airy. it has a minibar and a free safe. So its up to you. If you only want the vatican side its ok. But if you want the rest of the sites its not good. On the very positive side rome really does have some exceptional sites worth seeing. Dont just observe frome the outside go in and have a look. The catacombs are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, OK staff, but bad location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the zone hotel for three nights. The hotel was very modern, crisp, and refreshing. The overall hotel experience was great. There was only one set back, and you guessed it, it's the location. The shuttle worked okay but came back to early, so take 990 like everyone else said, it's kind of hard to figure out how to get around in rome so I would suggest finding a bus schedule/map. That way you know how to get from one side of rome to the other since their subway system is very simple and only consist of two lines. The air conditioner is also not a very strong aircondition unit and the refrigerator did not get nice and cold. There is a safe in the room that is incredibly easy to work, which was nice. Breakfast was fullfinling, light, and fresh. And be aware that this hotel does not offer laundry service as it says they do on the website. We only had one problem with one of the staff members and that was the lady that works in the morning at the desk, she was very unfriendly, unhelpful, quick, and made us feel like we were bothering her. Also be aware that when you sit down at a restaurant they charge a fee (around 2 euros) per person. This is considered to be there tip. But other than that it's a great city with lots of history, so enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: VonGuller
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this hotel last week for 6 nights. The hotel was clean and the stuff was friendly. The breakfest was good. The location is not perfect but manageable. The hotel has this shuttle bus to the piazza cavour as told before, but you have to book it in advance and the last shuttle back is at 6.30 p.m.(bit early). We used this shuttle a few times. Another possibility is to use bus 990(and this i recommend)which goes to the same piazza cavour from about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. This works fine if there is no strikes going on as we had for one day. On weekdays the bus goes like once in 15 minutes and on sudays about once in 30 minutes. We had to get to the ciampino airport early in the morning. We decided to use the 'cab' the hotel offered. It appeared to be the same shuttlebus that takes people to the city and was quite expensive. Ask a regular taxi for prices first. For the price we paid(62€/room/night) when booking from ryanairhotels this was a perfect hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect But Acquainted With Bus System”
Reviews.Author: mattes
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights last week. I can confirm all the positiv reviews posted before mine. I hope to give more clarity about getting to the hotel back-and forth town centre. 1) The hotel offers a shuttle (Mercedes Vito) going to Piazza Cavour every hour (except around mid-day). BUT you have to book your seat quite early the day before ! 2) BUS 990: It took me 5 minutes to get to the bus stop called BALDUINA/CERBONI. (it is the only bus passing the VIA CAROLIS) I took the bus twice from Piazza Cavour after 23°° and it took me exactly 25 minutes from departure to the reception of the hotel ! 3) N99: Night Bus. I tried this service and it worked. Be aware that you get off on a street called VIA MEDALLIE D ORO and that you need another 15 minutes after you get off the bus to get to the hotel.(walk down the piazza balduina and then up the hill toward via carolis) 4) FM3/FR3: SUBURBAN TRAIN: It took me 8 minutes to get to the station. There is a schedule on your left just at the entrance. There are on average 4 trains per hour running towards town centre. When you get off at the 2 station you can commute to the metro. 5)HOW I MANAGED TO GET THE TERRAVISON BUS AT TERMINI (departure 6:40) 05:37 I get on the Bus 990 at B/Cerboni 05:47 I get off the bus at via LEONE 05:52 I arrived at the OTTAVIANO station platform and got on the metro(lucky to catch it without waiting) 06:10 I arrived next to the Bus waiting at Via Marsala 06:38 TERRAVISION BUS left for CIAMPINO AIRPORT 07:06 arrived. Hope those information will help you decide wether or not you want to stay at the ZONE.... steph

Reviews.Title: “zone hotel will stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little afraid of what we would find. We were very happily suprised. We just returned from three nights at this hotel. We arrived by overnight train from Paris. There were five of us in our group. we had to take 2 cabs from termini station. Our cab fares were only 20 euros per car. you can't beat that. the hotel staff was very, very helpful. they spoke english and immediately responded when we didn't know how to turn on our room's air conditioner. we arrived early and they had the cleaning staff finish our rooms first so that we could go ahead and get into our rooms. we had three rooms between the five of us and they were all great. the cleaning staff was FANTASTIC. the shuttle service was great and would drop us off at either the vatican or piazza cavour. our shuttle driver also gave us specific directions to get back to the hotel late at night. the # 990 bus picks up at piazza cavour and drops you at the san Madonna dell cenacola stop 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel. the hotel is located in an affluent safe neighborhood. we saw many women out walking there dogs late at night. There was a lot to discover in this area (Balduina district). The hotel is located a little far out. However, with the shuttle and the #990 bus, we found it took us no more time to get to and from. We still stayed out late and had no problems problems getting back. We were all very, very satisfied with our stay and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: VTMChris
Reviews.Content: We were confused by some of the reviews we read prior to our trip... some said this hotel was close to the metro and others made it sound like it was way out in the suburbs... here's my take, hope it helps! About 1/2 mile away is a metro stop for Balduina, this is on the FM3 (aka FR3 line), as near as we can tell, this stands for "Free Metro" as you DO NOT need a ticket to board this train. You can make your connection at Valle Aurelia to the Red Line (Aka A Line) you do need a ticket at this point and I don't remember if you can purchase them at this station or not (on our first day we had walked the full two miles to Cipro station (Aka Vatican Museum on the A Line) and purchased our tickets there. So, it is close to a Metro Stop but consider the following: The Metro stops running around 10:30 or 11:30 pm depending... and restaurants often don't open for the evening until 7:30pm. Restaurants do not rush you and whenever we ate in town we missed the last train and had to walk all the way back (often 3 - 4 miles) and many cabs are unwilling to drive that far (we tried to catch a cab one night at St. Peters and we no sooner told the driver Via Alfredo Fusco and he said no). Upshots: The rooms are sound proofed, there are safes and small refrigerators in the rooms (nice features) the staff is friendly, helpful and speak English very well. The continental breakfast included croissants, rolls, salami, ham, Swiss cheese, corn flakes, Rice Crispies, Yogurt, canned fruit cocktail, oj, milk, water, tea and cappuccino... we never left hungry. A nearby restaurant known as Cappieri (spelling may not be quite right here) serves excellent food, the wait staff is very friendly, speaks English well and the prices were very reasonable. We ate there semi frequently as it was close to the hotel and we would not have to worry about the metro/cab situation. A party of four with 2 appetizers, 4 main dishes, 2 desserts and a bottle of house wine ran about 65 Euro total. As I said the food was very good, we were never disappointed. We were very happy here, but there will be some walking, or have a number handy to call a cab if you need one. Other than that it's a great place to stay and we would definitely stay there again! Hint, you can take the FM3 train all the way to Pyramide station and switch to the Blue Line (aka B) and it's one stop to Circo Massimo or two stops to Colosseo (Coliseum) without having to pass through the crowded and much maligned Termini station... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “all about location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, a good 3* hotel, but location is important too, especially when you are coming in for a city break. It was easy enough to get into town and out -you get the overground train 2 stops then get on LineA of the Metro( 2 linesA&B), this is in theory. We were unfortunate enough to have the metro lineA shut due to engineering works on 2 evenings. Thought we would get a bus to our connecting overground station, but we missed the last train back (just v unlucky, missed by 3 minutes) and this left us in the suburban, concrete dual carraigeway which was Valle Aurelia, trying desperately to get a bus/taxi/anything, back into town, a scary experience if you are not from the area. The rest of the time we muddled through with the buses, because no-one could give us precise directions where to catch the buses into town from, not even the hotel staff. I think it would be really helpful if this hotel gave a map with precise directions to the bus stops/no.s to get into the city. I think the best thing to do for anyone staying atthis hotel would be to get to grips with the bus system on day1 from & to the hotel, to get bearings understood in case of an unfortunate metro/train breakdown. The hotels shuttle bus does not go to the city centre but near the Vatican, which is great if you are visiting that for 1 day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: World_Quest
Reviews.Content: A very nice contemporary euro style hotel. The rooms were small but nicely appointed. Several nice touches included shoe buffers in the hallways, huge windows that you could open like doors, internet enabled computer in the lobby, a small bar, and most importantly a complimentary shuttle to downtown Rome. Although there is no onsite restaurant, they offer a complimentary breakfast of cheeses, meats, breads, cereals and fruits. The Zone is in the surburbs in a non commercial neighborhood. Its about 10-15 minutes away from the city centre by car. The upside to this is the peaceful quiet of the area. The downside is there is absolutely nothing to do there. There are a couple of restaurants/snack bars and tabacchi shops a few blocks away. If you do not have a car you will need to either use the shuttle or the public bus service to reach the tourist areas. I recommend getting accquainted with the bus/metro schedule since the shuttle isn't available after 7PM. There is a bus stop a couple of blocks from the hotel. If you take the bus to the Metro station you can get to most attractions relatively quickly. The Zone is great if you are adventurous enough to use public transportation and don't need many frills at your hotel. I'd love to stay there again.
